alert.note: Alert for Amherst (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Amherst County through 745 PM EDT... At 730 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Naola, or near Big Island, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amherst... Forks Of Buffalo... Naola... Pleasant View... Falconerville... and Elon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and south central Virginia.
